Sentencas: Molten Sn and Bi were examined at 973 and 1073 K for use as anodes in solid oxide fuel cells with yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolytes.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Cells were operated under battery conditions, with dry He flow in the anode compartment, to characterize the electrochemical oxidation of the metals at the YSZ interface.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: For both metals, the open-circuit voltages (OCVs) were close to that expected based on their oxidation thermodynamics, similar to 0.93 V for Sn and similar to 0.48 V for Bi.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: With Sn, the cell performance degraded rapidly after the transfer of approximately 0.5-1.5 C/cm(2) of charge due to the formation of a SnO2 layer at the YSZ interface.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: At 973 K, the anode impedance at OCV for freshly reduced Sn was approximately 3 cm(2) but this increased to well over 250 cm(2) after the transfer of 1.6 C/cm(2) of charge.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Following the transfer of 8.2 C/cm(2) at 1073 K, the formation of a 10 mu m thick SnO2 layer was confirmed by scanning electron microscopy.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: With Bi, the OCV anode impedance at 973 K was less than 0.25 cm(2) and remained constant until essentially all of the Bi had been oxidized to Bi2O3.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes

Sentencas: Some implications of these results for direct carbon fuel cells are discussed.
Titulo: A Comparison of Molten Sn and Bi for Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Anodes
